title: (x) Font for the Fuddruckers hamburgers logo - custom designed by Michael Doret {Mark S}
content:
I need to know the font for the text Fuddrucker & text Greatest that is just below the Fuddruckers

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141020182710im_/http:/typophile.com/files/1272-fuddruckers_5183.jpg)
author: artslons

comments.content:
They're not fonts. The logo was designed and drawn by Michael Doret: [http://www.michaeldoret.com/doret/artwork/fuddruckers.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20141020182710/http:/www.michaeldoret.com/doret/artwork/fuddruckers.html "http://www.michaeldoret.com/doret/artwork/fuddruckers.html")

(The version of the logo in the link is a bit different, but I'm sure Michael did the one in your sample as well.)

You are correct Mark. All the text on my original design was hand-lettered. Unfortunately some time after I did it changes were requested and (apparently) the agency had lost track of who had done the original (me!), so the hack job that is used now was created, I'm—assuming done in-house. The script of the word "Greatest" is done so poorly that it's beyond me why Artslons would want to replicate it.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141020182710im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Fuddruckers_3671.gif)

Sorry to hear that, Michael.

Also, is it just me, or should "WORLD'S GREATEST" be around the circle, and "Hamburgers" be positioned under "FUDDRUCKERS"?

- Lex
Ha! You're probably right . . . but that's the least of the problems in that "revised" logo.
